intro: Richella soyauxii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic to many animals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces capsule fruits that contain toxic seeds. Due to its medicinal properties and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
